name: Jason Ernst
content: Jason Ernst Lab | Jason Ernst Research Lab Skip to main content Jason Ernst Research Lab About the LabWe are a computational biology lab within the Department of Biological Chemistry in the David Geffen School of Medicine and also part of the Computer Science Department, the Computational Medicine Department, Interdepartmental Bioinformatics Program, the Institute for Quantitative and Computational Biosciences, the Broad Stem Cell Research Center, the Jonsson Comprehensive Cancer Center, and the Molecular Biology Institute at UCLA.The focus of the lab is on developing and applying computational methods to address problems in epigenomics, regulatory genomics, and non-coding genome interpretation. Recent NewsAugust 2025: A paper co-led by Luke analyzing whole genomes for association with psychiatric disorders is published online.July 2025: Jason co-authors a perspective on recent developments and challenges in regulatory and systems genomics.June 2025: Jennifer and Emily's paper on global patterns of epigenetic variation is published.June 2025: Luke's paper on de novo noncoding variants in autism and ENSAS is published.June 2025: Luke defends his PhD thesis.May 2025: Emily's paper on CMImpute is published.May 2025: Tev's paper on ChromActivity is published.View All News
